positive_examples: This is an example of double free attack.
The double free attack demonstrated clear characteristics.
We observed double free attack in this context.
A typical case of double free attack would involve these features.
The concept of double free attack applies here.
An attack that attempts to free the same memory location twice, potentially corrupting heap metadata.
negative_examples: This is an example of buffer overflow attack, not double free attack.
This represents memory corruption attack in general.
The document was filed in the cabinet.
She walked to the store to buy groceries.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: BufferOverflowAttack, or other types of MemoryCorruptionAttack

definition: A memory corruption exploit that frees the same memory location twice.
